column4: when i am in my ubuntu 11.04 it says over 50 gb of free space when in home folder, x64 but when i am in installer says i have no free space, is it b/c i made ubuntu 11.04 take the entire hard drive when installed it?
what you need is free partition with enough space
there are 4 linux downloads, 2 of those are 64 bit, so the other 2 are probably 32
thanks i will download the self extracting bin and install via terminal
any specific reason you need to do that and not use openjdk from repository?

well its not for me its for someone else as he is trying to get his android device back to stock factory conditions and in order for that to happen, he has to install java or update it to latest version in order to run a SamsungCaptivate-SGHi897-UCKB2-NoRoot-One-Click.jar
here is link he is following: http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1266172
then just try openjdk, manual installation is not really recommended
okay but when he clicks on jar file it says: The file SamsungCaptivate-SGHi897-UCKB2-NoRoot-One-Click.jar' is not marked as executable.
i guess he has to make it executable first with a: chmod a+x
okay will tell him to try to cd to where file is then run chmod a+x with "jar file name"
he can also do that via gui, right click properties
on pemissions tab there is a checkbox to mark it as executable
cool will tell him that now
that's just a security thingy for gui, so double clicking does not execute things you may not want to. On command line he don't need that: "java -jar blabla.jar" will execute it too
thanks for that tip, didn't know "java" command would also execute will make note of that for future use
